org.gvsig.timesupport.animation

Interface TimeAnimationDataModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TimeAnimationDataModelImpl

    public interface TimeAnimationDataModel
    Data model for animation. This is useful to configure the animation parameters. When the animation runs read the values of this object.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setWindowTime

        void setWindowTime(int windowTime)
        Assigns the window time. The scale is the selected with the method setWindowScale.
        Parameters:
        windowTime - Window of time of each step

      • getWindowTime

        Gets the window time. The scale is the selected with the method setWindowScale.

      • getWindowTimeScale

        int getWindowTimeScale()
        Returns a constant defined in TimeAnimation. This constant represents the scale of time of the window (year, month, day, ...)
        Returns:

      • setWindowTimeScale

        void setWindowTimeScale(int windowTimeScale)
        Assigns a constant defined in TimeAnimation. This constant represents the scale of time of the window (year, month, day, ...)

      • getTimeStepScale

        int getTimeStepScale()
        Returns a constant defined in TimeAnimation. This constant represents the scale of time of the time step (year, month, day, ...)
        Returns:

      • setTimeStepScale

        void setTimeStepScale(int timeStepScale)
        Assigns a constant defined in TimeAnimation. This constant represents the scale of time of the time step (year, month, day, ...)

      • setTimeWindow

        void setTimeWindow(RelativeInstant start,
                 RelativeInstant end)
        Sets the time window to visualize in each time instant. The time window is the amount of data to show in each step. At the beginning this window goes from the initial data time. When the animation has been started this window is moving along the time line.
        Parameters:
        start - Instant in which the animation starts
        end - Instant in which the animation ends

      • getEndTimeWindow

        RelativeInstant getEndTimeWindow()
        Gets the end of the time window to visualize in each time instant. The time window is the amount of data to show in each step. At the beginning this window goes from the initial data time. When the animation has been started this window is moving along the time line.
        Returns:
        RelativeInstant

      • getInitTimeWindow

        RelativeInstant getInitTimeWindow()
        Gets the begin of the time window to visualize in each time instant. The time window is the amount of data to show in each step. At the beginning this window goes from the initial data time. When the animation has been started this window is moving along the time line.
        Returns:
        RelativeInstant

      • setTimeInterval

        void setTimeInterval(RelativeInstant start,
                   RelativeInstant end)
        Sets the time interval. The time interval contains two date. The start date is the moment in which the animation starts and in the end date the animation ends.
        Parameters:
        timeWindowValue -

      • getInitTime

        RelativeInstant getInitTime()
        Gets the initial date of the time window to visualize in each time instant. The time window is the amount of data to show in each step.
        Returns:
        RelativeInstant

      • getEndTime

        RelativeInstant getEndTime()
        Gets the end date of the time window to visualize in each time instant. The time window is the amount of data to show in each step.
        Returns:
        RelativeInstant

      • getWindowTimeByPartOfData

        int[] getWindowTimeByPartOfData()
        Gets an array of seven values. Each element of this array represents the number of years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds of a window time.

      • getStepByPartOfData

        int[] getStepByPartOfData()
        Gets an array of seven values. Each element of this array represents the number of years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds of a step.

      • getSliderPosition

        RelativeInstant getSliderPosition()
        Gets the slider position. This position is specified in real time.
        Returns:
        RelativeInstant

      • setSliderPosition

        void setSliderPosition(RelativeInstant position)
        Assigns the slider position. This position is specified in real time.
        Parameters:
        position -
